channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: Minisforum's new super "mini pc" is anything but small - but what it does with that extra space should win it a lot of friends
item.description: The Minisforum MS-02 Ultra blends desktop-level hardware, extensive upgrade options, and fast networking in a larger mini PC design.
item.dc:creator: Efosa Udinmwen, TechRadar

item.title: AI buildout cements its role as a global catalyst this week
item.description: A momentous week in the technology sector made it clear there is no sign the boom in building artificial intelligence infrastructure is slowing — despite the bubble talk. Nvidia, whose processors are the AI revolution’s backbone, became the first company to surpass $5 trillion in market value.
item.dc:creator: Reuters, Fast Company

item.title: AMD has ended support for RX 6000 GPUs – here's why it's a massive blunder in the battle against Nvidia
item.description: In a baffling move, AMD ends support for relatively recent RX 6000 GPUs – and gamers are up in arms (myself included).
item.dc:creator: Darren Allan, TechRadar

item.title: Apple delivers strong quarter despite trade war challenges and ongoing artificial technology issues
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Apple delivered financial results during its summertime quarter that exceeded analyst projections, despite being caught in the crosshairs of a global trade war at the same time the trendsetting company is scrambling to catch up to its Big Tech peers in the artificial intelligenc
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Nvidia GTC news you need to know
item.description: Nvidia showcased a variety of advances at its GTC event (GPU Technology Conference) this week – everything from quantum computing inroads to a 6G wireless stack and improved partnerships with core vendors, including Cisco.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: 183 million email passwords leaked: Check yours now
item.description: Cybersecurity experts warn about one of the largest credential compilations ever found, urging users to check "Have I Been Pwned" and change passwords immediately.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Young T. rex or a new dinosaur? New bones add to the debate
item.description: Scientists say there’s new evidence that settles the origins of a mysterious dinosaur excavated in the 1940s.
item.dc:creator: Adithi Ramakrishnan, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: What’s the most malicious TLD? Cloudflare reveals surprising risks, usage patterns
item.description: The domain name system has evolved significantly since its inception. What started out as just a handful of generic top-level domains with .com, .net and .org has expanded to more than 1,400 valid TLDs as of October 2025. Another expansion round is scheduled to begin in April 2026.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Universal Music and AI song tool Udio settle lawsuit and partner on new platform, sparking backlash
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Universal Music Group and AI song generation platform Udio have settled a copyright infringement lawsuit and agreed to team up on new music creation and streaming platform, the two companies said in a joint announcement.
item.dc:creator: KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Mistake-filled legal briefs show the limits of relying on AI tools at work
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Judges around the world are dealing with a growing problem: legal briefs that were generated with the help of artificial intelligence and submitted with errors such as citations to cases that don’t exist, according to attorneys and court documents.
item.dc:creator: CATHY BUSSEWITZ, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: 5 hidden battery drainers you can fix right now
item.description: Quick iPhone and Android battery optimization techniques help your device stay powered all day by turning off hidden features that secretly drain power in the background.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: How tiny drones inspired by bats could save lives in dark and stormy conditions
item.description: Researchers at Worcester Polytechnic Institute are developing tiny drones inspired by bats for search and rescue missions.
item.dc:creator: Holly Ramer, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Unit testing Spring MVC applications with JUnit 5
item.description: Spring is a reliable and popular framework for building web and enterprise Java applications. In this article, you’ll learn how to unit test each layer of a Spring MVC application, using built-in testing tools from JUnit 5 and Spring to mock each component’s dependencies.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Broadcom refuses to backtrack on huge VMware price increases, claims European cloud watchdog
item.description: Broadcom is still trying to strongarm VMware customers into accepting huge price increases and onerous licensing terms, says the European Cloud Competition Observatory (ECCO) in its latest report.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Meta shares slide after company projects higher expenses for 2026
item.description: Meta's stock slid in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the tech giant posted strong third-quarter results but warned that its expenses will be significantly higher in 2026 than this year. Like its rivals, Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: BARBARA ORTUTAY, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Google's corporate parent posts first-ever quarter with $100B in revenue in latest show of its power
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Google’s corporate parent on Wednesday announced its first-ever quarter with more than $100 billion in revenue, a milestone that illustrates the unwavering power of its internet empire amid legal and competitive threats. The news of Alphabet Inc.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: IBM won’t sell VMware to new cloud customers
item.description: IBM has decided not to offer VMware and VMware Cloud Foundation to new cloud customers, paving the way for it to openly pitch Red Hat OpenShift as a virtualization option instead.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Microsoft Azure outage takes Xbox, Minecraft and 365 products offline
item.description: Downdetector shows fewer reports of 365 product disruptions, but Minecraft and Xbox outage reports remain elevated.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Oler, NewsNation

item.title: The top 4 JVM languages and why developers love them
item.description: The Java virtual machine provides a high-performance, universal runtime for a wealth of popular languages beyond just Java. In this article, we’ll look at the characteristic strengths and common use cases of four of the most popular JVM languages: Kotlin, Scala, Groovy, and Clojure.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: How to use passkeys to keep your computer safe
item.description: Learn how to use passkeys on Windows and Mac computers without cameras or fingerprint readers. Discover secure authentication methods that replace passwords.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4
